005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IEmailAddressItem;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
013
014import java.util.List;
015
016import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
017
018/**
019 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
020 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#email-address">email-address</a>
021 * data type.
022 */
023public class EmailAddressAdapter
024    extends AbstractStringAdapter<IEmailAddressItem> {
025  @NonNull
026  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
027      List.of(
028          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "email-address"),
029          // for backwards compatibility with original type name
030          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "email")));
031
032  EmailAddressAdapter() {
033    super(IEmailAddressItem.class, IEmailAddressItem::cast);
034  }
035
036  @Override
037  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
038    return NAMES;
039  }
040
041  @Override
042  public IEmailAddressItem newItem(Object value) {
043    String item = asString(value);
044    return IEmailAddressItem.valueOf(item);
045  }
046}
